Legal_Issue: Was the decision to deny asylum based on reasonable grounds?
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed refugee status due to persecution in Mexico but was deemed not credible.
Testimony had inconsistencies and lacked corroboration.
Failed to prove unavailability of state protection or impossibility of internal relocation.
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act subsection 72(1)
Credibility_Assessment: Testimony found inconsistent and not credible
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act s. 72(1)
Application_Basis: Refugee protection claim based on fear of persecution
Relief_Sought: Certification of a question for appeal
Governing_Rule: Federal Court reviews decisions for reasonableness
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to prove unavailability of state protection
Failure to establish impossibility of internal relocation
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed persecution in Mexico but failed to meet burden of proof due to credibility issues and lack of evidence on state protection and internal flight alternative
Evidence_Handling: Testimony assessed for consistency and plausibility
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act s. 72(1)
Decision_Rationale: No reviewable error; applicant did not demonstrate unavailability of state protection or impossibility of internal relocation
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide evidence on internal flight alternative
